author: @zazoomblog
title: Hamas accusata di attacco mortale a un autobus di operatori umanitari a Gaza
text:
Hamas accusata di attacco mortale a un autobus di operatori umanitari a Gaza
La tensione nella Striscia di Gaza si infittisce: un attacco attribuito a Hamas ha colpito un autobus di operatori umanitari, causando vittime e feriti. La Gaza Humanitarian Foundation denuncia un atto di violenza che mette a rischio lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢intera operazione di aiuti nella regione. In un contesto giÃƒ fragile, questo incidente solleva nuove preoccupazioni sulla stabilitÃƒ e sulla sicurezza degli interventi umanitari. La comunitÃƒ internazionale chiede chiarezza e azioni concrete per proteggere chi tenta di portare sollievo.
La Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, organizzazione privata sostenuta dagli Stati Uniti e attiva nella Striscia di Gaza, accusa Hamas di aver attaccato un autobus che trasportava i suoi operatori umanitari, causando almeno cinque morti e numerosi feriti. Lo ha reso noto la stessa fondazione in un comunicato. L'attacco sarebbe avvenuto intorno alle 22:00 ora locale di ieri, mentre il mezzo si dirigeva verso un centro di distribuzione di aiuti nell'area ovest di Khan Younis. A bordo c'erano oltre venti membri del team, tutti cittadini palestinesi impiegati come operatori umanitari. "Condanniamo con la massima fermezza questo attacco brutale e deliberato - si legge nella nota -.
[ðŸ”— Leggi su Quotidiano.net]
In questa notizia si parla di: gaza - hamas - attacco - autobus
Israele ordina evacuazione nella Striscia di Gaza: attacco imminente dopo razzi di Hamas - Israele ha ordinato l'evacuazione immediata di alcune aree del nord della Striscia di Gaza a seguito di un attacco imminente contro Hamas.
Una volta cÃ¢â‚¬â„¢erano i treni della felicitÃƒ , oggi ci sono gli autobus della speranza. ÃƒË† quello che hanno preso, partendo da Gaza e diretti in Giordania, Enas Abu Daqqa, una donna di trentÃ¢â‚¬â„¢anni, e sua figlia Niveen di soli sette mesi insieme ad altre madri e ad altri fig[Vai su Facebook]
Gaza Humanitarian Foundation: Ã‚Â«Hamas ha attaccato un autobus con a bordo i nostri operatoriÃ‚Â»; Hamas attacca un bus a Gaza e uccide 5 operatori umanitari palestinesi; Tentato attacco a Tel Aviv con ordigni su 5 autobus. Hamas restituisce i corpi di 4 ostaggi israeliani.
Hamas attacca un bus a Gaza e uccide 5 operatori umanitari palestinesi Da panorama.it: In un attacco brutale contro le attivitÃ  umanitarie, i miliziani di Hamas hanno assalito un autobus che trasportava operatori della Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF) nei dintorni di Khan Younis, prov ...

author: Gabriel Valery, da RBA
title: Sul tem alerta para novas chuvas. Mortos chegam a 107. Ã‰gua â€˜Carameloâ€™ Ã© salva
text:
SÃ£o Paulo â€“ O balanÃ§o mais recente da tragÃ©dia climÃ¡tica no Rio Grande do Sul dÃ¡ conta de que o nÃºmero de mortos chegou hoje (9) a 107. A Defesa Civil local divulgou estas informaÃ§Ãµes ao meio-dia. Eles ainda informam que este nÃºmero deve aumentar nos prÃ³ximos dias. Isso porque 136 pessoas seguem desaparecidas em razÃ£o das chuvas e inundaÃ§Ãµes. O nÃºmero de feridos Ã© de 374.
Os dados do governo do Rio Grande do Sul tambÃ©m revelam 379 mil pontos sem energia e 425 mil sem Ã¡gua no estado. As chuvas atingiram todo o estado, sendo que 85% das cidades tiveram impactos severos. O nÃºmero de pessoas que deixaram suas casas ultrapassa 200 mil. SÃ£o 67.563 desabrigados e 165.122 desalojados. Boa parte destas pessoas estÃ¡ em alojamentos improvisados pelo estado.
As aulas estÃ£o suspensas nas 2.338 escolas estaduais. SÃ£o mais de 327 mil alunos sem estudar no momento. De acordo com a gestÃ£o estadual, 75 escolas servem de abrigo temporÃ¡rio, 954 sofreram algum impacto direto das chuvas e 426 estÃ£o severamente danificadas.
Especialista pede reconstruÃ§Ã£o de cidades do Rio Grande do Sul em Ã¡reas seguras Governador do Rio Grande do Sul seguiu Ricardo Salles no desmonte ambiental EvacuaÃ§Ã£o total Algumas cidades sofreram impactos mais severos. Ã‰ o caso de Canoas e de Eldorado do Sul, na regiÃ£o metropolitana de Porto Alegre. A primeira registrou alagamento em metade de sua Ã¡rea total. JÃ¡ Eldorado do Sul estÃ¡ quase em sua totalidade submersa. NÃ£o hÃ¡ Ã¡gua ou energia elÃ©trica em nenhum ponto da cidade. A previsÃ£o Ã© de que as enchentes durem ainda 10 dias no local.
EntÃ£o, autoridades locais optaram por evacuar totalmente o municÃ­pio. SÃ£o 42.490 pessoas. Elas estÃ£o sendo deslocadas para outras cidades, particularmente no litoral. â€œAlguns prefeitos dessas cidades me ofereceram abrigo, ficaram de me mandar atÃ© Ã´nibus. As coisas estÃ£o se encaminhandoâ€, relatou o prefeito de Eldorado do Sul, Ernani de Freitas (PDT).
Perspectivas No inÃ­cio da tarde de hoje, o GuaÃ­ba ficou, pela primeira vez desde sÃ¡bado, abaixo dos 5 metros acima de seu nÃ­vel padrÃ£o. Desde seu Ã¡pice, na segunda-feira, o rio recuou 37 centÃ­metros, mas segue com 4,95 metros de elevaÃ§Ã£o. Trata-se da maior cheia do sistema do GuaÃ­ba registrado na histÃ³ria.
A boa notÃ­cia do recuo, contudo, nÃ£o alivia a situaÃ§Ã£o de muitos municÃ­pios. Em Porto Alegre, por exemplo, as ruas prÃ³ximas do rio, particularmente na regiÃ£o central, ilhas e bairros da orla, seguem alagadas. AlÃ©m disso, a chuva voltou a cair na regiÃ£o ontem, ainda que com menor intensidade. A formaÃ§Ã£o de um ciclone extratropical, alÃ©m de uma nova frente fria vinda da Argentina, impactam o clima na regiÃ£o nos prÃ³ximos dias.
A partir de amanhÃ£ (10), as chuvas voltam com maior intensidade no Sul do paÃ­s. Os volumes podem passar dos 100 milÃ­metros em algumas regiÃµes, particularmente no Norte do estado e no Leste, onde fica parte das cidades mais afetadas, como Canoas e Porto Alegre. As chuvas dos prÃ³ximos dias tambÃ©m colocam em alerta o sul catarinense. Existe uma grande preocupaÃ§Ã£o em relaÃ§Ã£o a regiÃ£o da Serra de Santa Catarina, que deve registrar grande volume de chuvas. EntÃ£o, segue o alerta mÃ¡ximo deste evento climÃ¡tico extremo na regiÃ£o Sul.
â€œCarameloâ€ Em meio ao caos no Rio Grande do Sul, um caso chamou a atenÃ§Ã£o da populaÃ§Ã£o de todos os cantos do Brasil. Caramelo Ã© uma Ã©gua que ficou dias ilhada em um pequeno telhado. Ela enfrentou dias de sol e chuva sem poder mover uma pata. O caso chamou a atenÃ§Ã£o de defensores de animais e tambÃ©m de autoridades. O presidente Luiz InÃ¡cio Lula da Silva ficou comovido com a histÃ³ria. Ele e sua companheira, Janja, sÃ£o muito ligados aos animais.
EntÃ£o, hoje, finalmente equipes conjuntas de bombeiros e ExÃ©rcito conseguiram resgatar o animal. Lula estava em um compromisso de anÃºncio de um pacote de ajudas para o estado quando Janja o avisou. Ele nÃ£o escondeu a alegria de saber que Caramelo estava segura e em terra firme.
O Caramelo foi resgatado! GraÃ§as Ã  mobilizaÃ§Ã£o dos voluntÃ¡rios e ao ExÃ©rcito, conseguimos salvar mais uma vida! pic.twitter.com/2s5bW6P6am

author: Get News
title: Gonstead Chiropractic Center Offers Relief for Peripheral Neuropathy | observernewsonline.com
text:
Expert chiropractors at Gonstead Chiropractic Center introduce specialized care for those experiencing numbness or tingling in hands or feet due to peripheral neuropathy. Gonstead Chiropractic Center, under the guidance of Dr. Rich Benjamin, announces its commitment to aiding individuals grappling with peripheral neuropathy, a condition characterized by numbness or tingling in the extremities. The center now provides specialized chiropractic care targeting the root causes of peripheral neuropathy, offering hope for relief and improved quality of life.
Peripheral neuropathy, a condition affecting nerves outside the brain and spinal cord, can lead to debilitating sensations of weakness, numbness, and pain, particularly in the hands and feet. Dr. Rich Benjamin explains, "Our body's wiring system, akin to peripheral nerves, facilitates essential functions such as movement and sensory perception. When damaged, it can disrupt the transmission of vital signals, leading to discomfort and reduced mobility."
With a focus on patient-centered care, Gonstead Chiropractic Center employs a multi-faceted approach to alleviate symptoms and address the underlying causes of peripheral neuropathy. By combining cutting-edge medical treatments with personalized lifestyle adjustments, the center aims to provide rapid and lasting relief for its patients.
Individuals experiencing symptoms of peripheral neuropathy are encouraged to schedule a 29 Point Sensory Exam, tailored to assess their unique condition comprehensively. Through personalized assessment and targeted treatment plans, the center endeavors to restore function and enhance the overall well-being of its patients.
For more information about Gonstead Chiropractic Center and its specialized care for peripheral neuropathy, visit https://gonsteadchiropracticcenter.com/ now.
About Gonstead Chiropractic Center
Gonstead Chiropractic Center, led by Dr. Rich Benjamin, specializes in holistic care for individuals experiencing peripheral neuropathy symptoms like numbness and tingling in the hands or feet. With a patient-centered approach, the center offers personalized treatment plans, combining cutting-edge medical techniques with lifestyle adjustments to provide rapid and lasting relief.
Media Contact

Contact Person: Dr. Rich Benjamin
Email: Send Email

Country: United States
Website: https://gonsteadchiropracticcenter.com/

author: The Motley Fool
title: Why Semiconductor Equipment Stocks Applied Materials, Lam Research, and KLA Corp. Rallied Today
text:
Shares of semiconductor equipment giants rallied big on Thursday, with Applied Materials (NASDAQ: AMAT), Lam Research (NASDAQ: LRCX), and KLA Corporation (NASDAQ: KLAC) jumping 4.5%, 4%, and 4.3%.
These three stocks collectively account for much of the large oligopoly in semiconductor equipment, and each stock has had excellent long-term returns as a result. However, the near-term picture hasn't been as good, with each down between 20% and 32% from their summer highs.
Start Your Mornings Smarter! Wake up with Breakfast news in your inbox every market day. Sign Up For Free Â»
But could that pullback be ending as of today? On Thursday, these stocks got a big boost following Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing's (NYSE: TSM) fourth-quarter earnings release in which TSMC forecast higher-than-expected capital expenditures for the coming year, supporting what it sees as a massive five-year growth cycle ahead.
TSMC's spending-palooza
TSMC is the most important manufacturer in the semiconductor manufacturing industry by far. While other chip manufacturers are trying to catch up with this market leader, TSMC currently has a near-monopoly on today's leading-edge semiconductor production, supporting the world's biggest chip designers, from Nvidia to Apple.
Thus, while these companies also have large memory businesses, a lot of their logic revenue comes from TSMC. And again, these stocks were down since summer as investors have come to wonder about the sustainability of the AI buildout. Additionally, non-AI semiconductor markets in PCs and smartphones have been somewhat lackluster.
However, TSMC's commentary on the future likely put many concerns to rest. TSMC management now predicts a near-20% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) for revenue over the next five years, from 2025-2029. Unsurprisingly, that overall outlook is bolstered by a predicted mid-40% annual CAGR for AI accelerators. TSMC noted that AI chips accounted for almost a mid-teens percentage of overall revenue in 2024, with that percentage set to increase significantly.
That growth of course will need to be supported by new semiconductor equipment, and TSMC forecasts reaccelerating its capital expenditures in the coming year to between $38 billion and $42 billion. That's up a significant 33% at the midpoint over the amount spent in 2024, and also well above the prior annual peak of $36.3 billion spent in 2022.
Needless to say, a 33% increase in capital expenditures bodes well for Applied, Lam, and KLA. Applied and Lam both make critical etch and deposition equipment for laying down and stripping away transistor materials. Because of the switch to gate-all-around transistors coming this year, as well as the advent of backside power delivery likely in 2026, both Lam and Applied are set to see an expansion of their addressable market, since these innovations require more intense etch and deposition steps.
Additionally, all of these meticulous manufacturing steps have to be measured for defects at every stage of the process. As the dominant market share leader in metrology and process control equipment, KLA should also see a benefit from TSMC's spending plans.
Semiconductor capital equipment stocks are great long-term holds despite volatility
Each of these semiconductor equipment vendors are excellent buy-and-hold stocks for the long-term investor. Not only is each correlated to the dynamic semiconductor industry, which should grow above GDP for some time, but these companies are also highly profitable and return lots of cash to shareholders.
The downside is that these stocks can also be highly volatile. After all, these names are down 20%-30% from their highs, and the semiconductor market hasn't even been in a traditional bear market.
But while these names are cyclical, the chip industry should continue to innovate and make new highs over time. So for investors who can handle 40% or larger drawdowns every so often, these stocks should be on their buy list whenever they dip. Today's strong move off their recent six-month lull is illustration of that.
Donâ€™t miss this second chance at a potentially lucrative opportunity
Ever feel like you missed the boat in buying the most successful stocks? Then youâ€™ll want to hear this.
On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a â€œDouble Downâ€ stock recommendation for companies that they think are about to pop. If youâ€™re worried youâ€™ve already missed your chance to invest, now is the best time to buy before itâ€™s too late. And the numbers speak for themselves:
- Nvidia: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009, youâ€™d have $353,272!*
- Apple: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2008, youâ€™d have $45,049!*
- Netflix: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, youâ€™d have $457,459!*
Right now, weâ€™re issuing â€œDouble Downâ€ alerts for three incredible companies, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon.
*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025
Billy Duberstein and/or his clients have positions in Apple, Applied Materials, KLA, Lam Research, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Applied Materials, Lam Research, Nvidia, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.
